posts.cooked:
Currently in group chats, if at least one person reads the message , the icon displayed is the two checkmarks with filled background.
As such, it’s not clear whether one recipient read the message , or all recipients.

For comparison, WhatsApp will only show read status if ALL recipients read the message.

I recommend to introduce a new icon for group chats if all recipients read the message , different than if one recipient read the message.

This can be achieved with 3 check marks:

  • one empty check mark if sent
  • two empty check marks if delivered to at least one recipient
  • third empty check mark if delivered to all
  • background fill the second check mark if at least one person read the message
  • background fill the third check mark if all recipients read the message

With the above, the convention for 1-to-1 chats is not broken, and there’s more info for group chats.

Note that I know one can click on the info button to find out more, but that’s many steps that can be bypassed with an extra little indicator.

link_counts.title: "Read" indicators: 1 = read by one, 2 = read by all

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked:
Just a note that there are related feature requests, although they propose ideas for showing the number of (or exactly who) has received or read a given message, unlike this request which is simply “at least one user” or “everyone in the group”.

  • Show Individual Read Receipts for Group Chats in the Conversation
  • Please add a more detailed sent/delivered indicator for group chats

link_counts.title: Show Individual Read Receipts for Group Chats in the Conversation
Please add a more detailed sent/delivered indicator for group chats

posts.cooked:
Thanks for pointing to the other posts.
I feel like the other solutions are perhaps too fine grained and would require non-trivial visual real estate.

What I’m recommending should be a trivial extension to the existing way of displaying “read” and “delivered” info. Should at least address the vast majority of use cases , and is a step up over the current approach imho.

Rather than adding check marks (which could become visually confusing at a glance), I’d like to see the words
Sent
Delivered
Delivered to all
Read
Read by all

Seems clear and painless

posts.name: Shreyansh
posts.cooked:
An addition of ‘R’ beside double ticks to show Read by All should do the job.

Background fill for : Read by one.
An R beside filled Background: Read by All.

Too taxing on the UI. Also, too many states to cover with text : read by one and delivered to some. Read by all and delivered to some. Read by all. Etc.
I would think it’s much simpler to trivially extend the existing convention. But obviously I could be wrong.

Why introduce a new convention , being the letter R … just extend the existing convention … also, the third check mark with no background will indicate delivered to all , which the R won’t do … you’d think maybe let’s have D and replace D with R when read by all… but really why not just use the check marks convention .

Eh, I don’t think you’re necessarily wrong, but I should clarify that not all states are covered. “Read” in a group setting means “read by some.” The same goes for “delivered.”

I just think that the difference between 2 and 3 checks at a glance may be harder to distinguish than we think unless they were a bit more spaced. Then, we’d have to think about screen real estate at that point. By comparison, the word system looks cleaner to me (iMessage does it for individual chats, and I believe Google Messages does it for groups as well) and is less prone to misreading (in the two languages I typically view; not sure about others).

Maybe a solution would be to use a different system altogether: have a status bar that goes from left to right. A grey bar advances towards the right as the message gets delivered. Blue chases it as the message gets read. All the way on the right is 100%. Or maybe just two numbers: one grey (received) and one blue (read). Or both systems!

That’s some out of the box thinking, but I don’t dislike it! I’m wondering about readability and the time it would take to register cognitively as the person tries to discern how many have read. Maybe something like having the bar move in percents (25, 50, 75, 100)?

It’s a fun thought experiment. I think I’m still sold on the words being best, but I would prefer what you described to even the check marks we have now, I think

Interesting to see how diverging the opinions can be on the UI feedback w.r.t. read/delivered diversity has its beauty , doesn’t it…

IMHO the word system of iMessage is vague and not very telling in group chats. I am never able to tell who read my messages …

I personally like the check mark system and visual clues, and would recommend to non-controversially extend. Visual real estate needed for the third check mark would be minimal, especially that the check marks are stacked.

The progress bar is cool , but hard to apply to each individual message sent i’d think , especially that different messages have different widths (though max width is constant)

I also thought about the issue of actually knowing when it was sent/read 100%–maybe a little flag at the end. For very large groups the qualitative display of the bar is better, imo. For smaller groups, perhaps up to 10 or 20 members, it could be actual bars, divided up into sets of 5, for example.
Agreed, this needs an overhaul. It’s hard to tell the actual status from the icon alone, and it is hard to read depending on the message background altogether.

Hmm, good point about the length of the progress bar. Maybe just three numbers received/read/total users? That would take up more space, of course. If there are good arguments for saving space in the messages, I think a fuzzy indicator like the three check marks is best.

Right now the read receipts in group chats fill in (indicating read) when 1 member reads it.

I am asking for an indication that all members in the group have read the message.

2 proposals:

  1. Using the selected chat bubble color, display a “read by less than the entire group” reciept Color that is either darker or lighter than the bubble. Then, the white indicator can be “read by all”

  2. Make the white indicator “read by 1”, and a shade of the bubble color the “read by all” indicator

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: What messaging apps do this?

Maybe an underline with the two ticks to show all members have read the message? This is more suitable for light/dark theme and colour-blind users.
Would it be too much to show a progress bar under the message in the bubble which fills in as more people read the message?
At a quick glance it would be possible to see approx 50% of members have seen the message. Possibly limit this to milestones of 25%, 50%, 75% and 100% ?
Edit 1: and a setting for admins to show/hide these Read milestones?
Edit 2: like this (press Run Pen and scroll down to the middle, or run at 0.5x or 0.25x):

progress bar

I like the idea, but my goal for the FR was to not change too much with the current system.

Whatnoww:

What messaging apps do this?

I don’t know of any that have 2 “phases” of read-ness, but some apps only show the “read” indicator after everyone has read

posts.name: Ponytail
posts.cooked: WhatsApp have this feature.
Underline below the 2 ticks would be a small visual indicator like the dot for voice messages
